Tune in to learn how to become a great backend engineer from the experiences of other great backend engineers. Your host, Solomon Eseme.</itunes:summary>

		<itunes:image href="https://d3t3ozftmdmh3i.cloudfront.net/staging/podcast_uploaded_nologo/41498016/41498016-1721177709820-44dfa766ca88f.jpg"/>
		<item>
			<title><![CDATA[Let’s talk about Rust: Rust and AWS Serverless with Luciano]]></title>
			<description><![CDATA[<p>Luciano Mammino, Senior Architect and author of “Node.js Design Patterns,” joins Solomon Eseme, Founder and CTO of Masteringbackend and author of “Rust Essentials”, to discuss the powerful combination of Rust and serverless computing. 🦀In this podcast, Luciano shares his experience with Rust and AWS Lambda and how they interact. He provides practical examples of building Rust applications and deploying them to AWS Lambda.We covered:🧠 Why Rust’s performance and type system make it surprisingly good for backend development💸 How faster cold starts and smaller binaries can mean lower cloud bills📉 The real tradeoffs (like a steeper learning curve and smaller community)🔧 Best practices for shipping Rust Lambdas — including Infrastructure as Code and using tools like cargo lambda👨‍💻 Plus, a live coding session where I scaffold, test, and deploy a real Lambda with Rust — all in minutes!</p><ul><li>Become A Rust Backend Engineer: <a href="https://www.youtube.com/redirect?event=video_description&redir_token=QUFFLUhqbWRGSV85dkluTktoUjVCRXV2ZmlrRmZKTFRiZ3xBQ3Jtc0tsRkhram9xWm5MR29vZjFtQjhtS1NjXzNycEZKWXZTY0NwcDhNOVp6Y1FtcExGRklGRDhyNno3amtWMG5Ybk0wbnZVTkZLM2I4bUR6V05yRVlVVWR5Q3plNmVWcXBKV1AzclA1bEZkRGxfYXpaZGdLQQ&q=https%3A%2F%2Fmasteringbackend.com%2Fcourses%2Fbecome-a-rust-backend-engineer&v=Zqi-zRoTErI" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">https://masteringbackend.com/courses/...</a></li></ul><ul><li>Lambda Runtime Benchmarks: <a href="https://www.youtube.com/redirect?event=video_description&redir_token=QUFFLUhqa1dkRnI0X2RjMnJVN3B0NDkxcTlYbXBQcnJLQXxBQ3Jtc0tsU3M0NHpscmFrSGZvaVpNUHo0QWhpYlU2dGdjWGdNVTh0M2hJazFvVHdRUGhrSzBuU3lfXzFZNTJiWWhHOXlMMVVFa2ViNk5mU3hqWkNIUTBRbGdPSmk0R2RIWTN0dDN2bXpvZHktOGxCTzYwWGZxNA&q=https%3A%2F%2Fmaxday.github.io%2Flambda-perf%2F&v=Zqi-zRoTErI" href="https://www.youtube.com/redirect?event=video_description&redir_token=QUFFLUhqbnpxZ0hBVS1oQm0wNmtUbUwtQTRXSlYweHVhUXxBQ3Jtc0tubmt4RVc0MGlOekNJU2pWNDAxdk9LMUNNM3hkYlk1bjZxaGVmTWl3M2h6QkNwMjktdVI0NFlRZndKbXNVSVFjOUxndGw1Qk1nNktmMl9ZTUpGNGtYZG1TQnVrM3lseXJNUWVZSXpIUHlLdEZrZm91SQ&q=https%3A%2F%2Fslides.com%2Flucianomammino%2Funleashing-serverless-performance-writing-optimized-aws-lambda-functions-with-rust&v=Zqi-zRoTErI" href="https://www.youtube.com/redirect?event=video_description&redir_token=QUFFLUhqbmhOVzVFaEdhVWcyQUQ0UFRRa3ZfNHJwbUluZ3xBQ3Jtc0tuN1RZcjdYaXAxalp4WVJ1WkpYR0U0M2MwUE9OU1FKaFB2eTl5aS1DbkJsTlNnaTJJem01Snplb1dNdWd5d29FazJaZ0dtOVl3U0w4VHJjV3RRRTRlLVV1SGhfbUgzdTQ2V3U2QjZBVUUzMHR6XzJyMA&q=https%3A%2F%2Fllogiq.github.io%2F2024%2F03%2F28%2Feasy.html&v=Zqi-zRoTErI" 			<itunes:summary>&lt;p&gt;Luciano Mammino, Senior Architect and author of “Node.js Design Patterns,” joins Solomon Eseme, Founder and CTO of Masteringbackend and author of “Rust Essentials”, to discuss the powerful combination of Rust and serverless computing. 🦀In this podcast, Luciano shares his experience with Rust and AWS Lambda and how they interact. He provides practical examples of building Rust applications and deploying them to AWS Lambda.We covered:🧠 Why Rust’s performance and type system make it surprisingly good for backend development💸 How faster cold starts and smaller binaries can mean lower cloud bills📉 The real tradeoffs (like a steeper learning curve and smaller community)🔧 Best practices for shipping Rust Lambdas — including Infrastructure as Code and using tools like cargo lambda👨‍💻 Plus, a live coding session where I scaffold, test, and deploy a real Lambda with Rust — all in minutes!&lt;/p&gt;&lt;ul&gt;&lt;li&gt;Become A Rust Backend Engineer: &lt;a href=&quot;https://www.youtube.com/redirect?event=video_description&amp;redir_token=QUFFLUhqbWRGSV85dkluTktoUjVCRXV2ZmlrRmZKTFRiZ3xBQ3Jtc0tsRkhram9xWm5MR29vZjFtQjhtS1NjXzNycEZKWXZTY0NwcDhNOVp6Y1FtcExGRklGRDhyNno3amtWMG5Ybk0wbnZVTkZLM2I4bUR6V05yRVlVVWR5Q3plNmVWcXBKV1AzclA1bEZkRGxfYXpaZGdLQQ&amp;q=https%3A%2F%2Fmasteringbackend.com%2Fcourses%2Fbecome-a-rust-backend-engineer&amp;v=Zqi-zRoTErI&quot; 			<itunes:episodeType>full</itunes:episodeType>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title><![CDATA[Microservices for Backend Engineers]]></title>
			<description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of the “The Backend Podcast, we’re thrilled to have Vikas Rajpu join us as our 5th guest! With his extensive experience in backend engineering, Vikas shares invaluable insights on a critical topic: &quot;Microservices for Backend Engineers&quot;

This podcast will cover:

• What are Microservices?
• Why do we need them in the first place?
• How do we transition from Monolith to Microservice?
• How to build a secure Microservice?
• How to scale Microservice?
• Popular design patterns in Microservice
• When not to use Microservice?

🔔 Don’t forget to subscribe to our channel for more episodes from the “Great Backend Engineer” series!

<a href="https://www.youtube.com/hashtag/backendengineering">#BackendEngineering</a> <a href="https://www.youtube.com/hashtag/datastructures">#DataStructures</a> <a href="https://www.youtube.com/hashtag/algorithms">#Algorithms</a> <a href="https://www.youtube.com/hashtag/advancedbackendbootcamp">#AdvancedBackendBootcamp</a> <a href="https://www.youtube.com/hashtag/softwaredevelopment">#SoftwareDevelopment</a> <a href="https://www.youtube.com/hashtag/techpodcast">#TechPodcast</a>

LINKS

			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Solomon Eseme]]></dc:creator>
			<pubDate>Tue, 17 Sep 2024 15:03:02 GMT</pubDate>
			<enclosure url="https://anchor.fm/s/f7f18900/podcast/play/91828678/https%3A%2F%2Fd3ctxlq1ktw2nl.cloudfront.net%2Fstaging%2F2024-8-17%2F386528398-44100-2-87376de41b9da.m4a" length="56927462" type="audio/x-m4a"/>
			<itunes:summary>&lt;p&gt;In this episode of the “The Backend Podcast, we’re thrilled to have Vikas Rajpu join us as our 5th guest! With his extensive experience in backend engineering, Vikas shares invaluable insights on a critical topic: &amp;quot;Microservices for Backend Engineers&amp;quot;

This podcast will cover:

• What are Microservices?
• Why do we need them in the first place?
• How do we transition from Monolith to Microservice?
• How to build a secure Microservice?
• How to scale Microservice?
• Popular design patterns in Microservice
• When not to use Microservice?

🔔 Don’t forget to subscribe to our channel for more episodes from the “Great Backend Engineer” series!

		<item>
			<title><![CDATA[Importance of Data Structures and Algorithms For Backend Engineers]]></title>
			<description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of the “Great Backend Engineer” podcast, we’re thrilled to have Fernando join us as our 4th guest! With his extensive experience in backend engineering, Fernando shares invaluable insights on a critical topic: &quot;Do Backend Engineers Need Data Structures and Algorithms?&quot;</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>We dive deep into why these foundational concepts are essential, how often they’re used in daily backend tasks, and the real-world impact they can have on the performance and scalability of backend systems. </p>
<p><br></p>
<p>Fernando also discusses common pitfalls for engineers who may lack a strong grasp of these concepts and offers practical advice for those looking to strengthen their knowledge.</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>Whether you’re a seasoned backend engineer or just starting, this episode is packed with actionable strategies and expert advice to help you level up your backend skills.</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>🔔 Don’t forget to subscribe to our channel for more episodes from the “Great Backend Engineer” series!</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>#BackendEngineering #DataStructures #Algorithms #AdvancedBackendBootcamp #SoftwareDevelopment #TechPodcast</p>

&lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;Fernando also discusses common pitfalls for engineers who may lack a strong grasp of these concepts and offers practical advice for those looking to strengthen their knowledge.&lt;/p&gt;

		<item>
			<title><![CDATA[Building better softwares using internal tools]]></title>
			<description><![CDATA[<p>Another Episode of the GBE Podcast on &quot;Building better software using internal tools&quot;</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>This episode is sponsored by <a href="https://alerty.ai?ref=gbe_podcast?utm_source=gbe_podcast" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferer">Alerty.ai</a></p>
<p><br></p>
<p>In this episode, I host Johnny Dallas, a backend software engineer with over 8+ years of experience, to discuss the following concepts.</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>- How far can a solo dev scale?</p>
<p>- What is DevOps, and why do we need it?</p>
<p>- Why does internal tooling matter?</p>
<p>- Why does CI/CD matter? Why is deployment so complicated?</p>
<p>- What is monitoring, what is observability? Why are they important?</p>
<p>- How do you monitor a web app?</p>
<p>- How does observability scale with infrastructure complexity?</p>
<p>- Building better software</p>
<p>- What’s relevant to the backend engineer (managing 50 servers)</p>
<p>- JavaScript monitoring</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>If you&#39;re interested in this kind of discussion. Then, consider subscribing to the <a href="https://studio.youtube.com/channel/UCECTWjjj21fa2bNQ07PKE3A" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferer">YouTube channel</a> and turning on the notification.</p>
]]></description>
			<link>https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/gbe/episodes/Building-better-softwares-using-internal-tools-e2m8ilv</link>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">2b14d135-2813-4e45-bcb4-9225871be545</guid>
			<dc:creator><![CDATA[Solomon Eseme]]></dc:creator>
			<pubDate>Sat, 27 Jul 2024 13:38:35 GMT</pubDate>
			<enclosure url="https://anchor.fm/s/f7f18900/podcast/play/89458815/https%3A%2F%2Fd3ctxlq1ktw2nl.cloudfront.net%2Fstaging%2F2024-6-27%2F383909109-44100-2-b6820261e64c2.m4a" length="55113328" type="audio/x-m4a"/>
			<itunes:summary>&lt;p&gt;Another Episode of the GBE Podcast on &amp;quot;Building better software using internal tools&amp;quot;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;This episode is sponsored by &lt;a href=&quot;https://alerty.ai?ref=gbe_podcast?utm_source=gbe_podcast&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; rel=&quot;noopener noreferer&quot;&gt;Alerty.ai&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;In this episode, I host Johnny Dallas, a backend software engineer with over 8+ years of experience, to discuss the following concepts.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;- How far can a solo dev scale?&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;- What is DevOps, and why do we need it?&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;- Why does internal tooling matter?&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;- Why does CI/CD matter? Why is deployment so complicated?&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;- What is monitoring, what is observability? Why are they important?&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;- How do you monitor a web app?&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;- How does observability scale with infrastructure complexity?&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;- Building better software&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;- What’s relevant to the backend engineer (managing 50 servers)&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;- JavaScript monitoring&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;If you&amp;#39;re interested in this kind of discussion. Then, consider subscribing to the &lt;a href=&quot;https://studio.youtube.com/channel/UCECTWjjj21fa2bNQ07PKE3A&quot; target=&quot;_blank&quot; rel=&quot;noopener noreferer&quot;&gt;YouTube channel&lt;/a&gt; and turning on the notification.&lt;/p&gt;
</itunes:summary>
			<itunes:explicit>No</itunes:explicit>
			<itunes:duration>00:56:47</itunes:duration>
			<itunes:image href="https://d3t3ozftmdmh3i.cloudfront.net/staging/podcast_uploaded_episode/41498016/41498016-1722086081548-0d019b3b5332f.jpg"/>
			<itunes:episode>3</itunes:episode>
			<itunes:episodeType>full</itunes:episodeType>
		</item>
		<item>
			<title><![CDATA[API Monitoring and Observability for Backend Engineers]]></title>
			<description><![CDATA[<p><strong>Summary</strong></p>
<p>In our latest podcast, we had the pleasure of hosting Anthony to discuss the crucial aspects of API Monitoring and Observability. Anthony shared his extensive experience, covering everything from the basics of structured logging to advanced monitoring strategies. Here&#39;s a recap of the key points and insights from our conversation.</p>
<p><strong>Highlights</strong></p>
<p><em><strong>Basics of Structured Logging</strong></em></p>
<p>Anthony explained the foundational concept of structured logging, emphasizing its importance for backend engineers. Structured logging involves using a consistent format of key-value pairs, making logs more searchable and analyzable.</p>
<p><em><strong>Differences Between Structured and Traditional Logging</strong></em></p>
<p>Anthony delved into the nuances of structured logging versus traditional logging, highlighting the benefits of consistency and contextual metadata. He also shared best practices for effective implementation.</p>
<p><em><strong>Importance of Monitoring in Backend Engineering</strong></em></p>
<p>Anthony discussed the critical role of monitoring in maintaining the health and performance of APIs. Effective monitoring helps detect issues, proactively troubleshoot, and minimize downtime.</p>
<p><em><strong>Tools and Techniques for Observability</strong></em></p>
<p>Anthony recommended several tools and techniques for achieving effective observability:</p>
<ul>
 <li><strong>Prometheus</strong> for metrics collection and alerting.</li>
 <li><strong>Grafana</strong> for real-time dashboards.</li>
 <li><strong>Datadog</strong> for comprehensive monitoring, logging, and analytics.</li>
 <li><strong>ELK Stack</strong> for log management and analysis.</li>
</ul>
<p><em><strong>Building a Robust Monitoring Strategy</strong></em></p>
<p>For backend engineers starting with API monitoring and observability, Anthony outlined key steps to build a robust strategy:</p>
<ul>
  <li>Implement structured logging.</li>
  <li>Set up basic monitoring with tools like Prometheus and Grafana.</li>
  <li>Configure alerts for critical metrics.</li>
  <li>Integrate multiple observability tools for comprehensive insights.</li>
  <li>Continuously review and improve the monitoring strategy.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Key Insights</strong></p>
<p><em><strong>Consistency and Context in Logging</strong></em></p>
<p>Structured logging provides a consistent format and includes contextual metadata, significantly enhancing the ability to diagnose issues and analyze performance.</p>
<p><em><strong>Proactive Monitoring</strong></em></p>
<p>Monitoring is essential for proactive issue detection and troubleshooting, ensuring system reliability and performance.</p>
<p><em><strong>Comprehensive Observability</strong></em></p>
<p>Combining various tools and techniques allows for a holistic view of system health and performance, making it easier to maintain and optimize backend systems.</p>
<p><em><strong>Step-by-Step Strategy</strong></em></p>
<p>Starting with the basics and progressively building a robust monitoring strategy ensures a strong foundation for maintaining API health and performance.</p>
<p>Stay tuned for more expert insights in our upcoming podcasts!</p>
<p><br></p>
<p>LINKS:</p>
<p><a href="https://apitoolkit.io?ref=gbe_podcast" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferer">APIToolKit</a></p>
<p><a href="https://twitter.com/tonialaribe" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferer">Anthony Twitter</a></p>
<p><a href="https://academy.masteringbackend.com?ref=gbe_podcast" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferer">MasteringBackend Academy</a></p>
]]></description>

Anthony shared his extensive experience, covering everything from the basics of structured logging to advanced monitoring strategies. Here&amp;#39;s a recap of the key points and insights from our conversation.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Highlights&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Basics of Structured Logging&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p&gt;Anthony discussed the critical role of monitoring in maintaining the health and performance of APIs. Effective monitoring helps detect issues, proactively troubleshoot, and minimize downtime.&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;/ul&gt;

&lt;p&gt;For backend engineers starting with API monitoring and observability, Anthony outlined key steps to build a robust strategy:&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;ul&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;Implement structured logging.&lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;Set up basic monitoring with tools like Prometheus and Grafana.&lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;Configure alerts for critical metrics.&lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;li&gt;Integrate multiple observability tools for comprehensive insights.&lt;/li&gt;

&lt;/ul&gt;

			<title><![CDATA[Importance of Database in Backend engineering]]></title>
			<description><![CDATA[<p>The Great Backend Engineering (GBE) is Masteringbackend&#39;s official podcast.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/raul-junco/?lipi=urn%3Ali%3Apage%3Ad_flagship3_profile_view_base_recent_activity_content_view%3BZaOaVxHFRbyMf%2FD%2FW0h%2FFQ%3D%3D" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferer">Raul Junco</a> &amp; I jumped on a call to discuss the importance of Databases for Backend engineers.</p>
<p>Here&#39;s what we discussed</p>
<ul>
 <li>- Why mastering databases is important</li>
 <li>- What are the most common mistakes backend engineers make with databases</li>
 <li>- How database experience saved the day</li>
 <li>- How do you see the role of databases evolving in the next five years</li>
  <li>- Advice for new backend engineers.</li>
</ul>
<p>We discussed topics such as:</p>
<ul>
  <li>- Modeling Databases</li>
  <li>- Normalization</li>
  <li>- Database Indexing</li>
  <li>- Schema naming</li>
  <li>- Database Security</li>
  <li>- Backups and Restores</li>
  <li>- SQL</li>
  <li>- No-SQL</li>
  <li>- and more</li>
</ul>
]]></description>
